Being a mom of three young ones, I appreciate it's compactness and I love that I don't have to carry around a clunky DSLR or SLR-like point-and-shoot to get worthwhile photos! I previously owned a less powerful Canon Powershot, the SD 1100 IS Digital Elph, and the lens is going out after 3.5 years, but that could be due to dropping and dirt in the lens. We tried to fix it (no go) but I don't think it reflects poorly on the quality of the camera or brand itself. GO CANON!

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioning Lens Cover
Reviews.Author: Ross Capdeville "jiadar"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent pictures but is extremely delicate. I keep this camera in a pelican case, and take it out in benign conditions for shooting nature scenes. The camera functioned well through about 100 pictures, after which the lens cover fails to open and close. To take a picture, you then have to manually slide the lens cover open. This is a fatal design flaw and I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: All is very good, but a couple of alerts for you
Reviews.Author: 1/2 Canadian
Reviews.Content: All the good things have been said about the SX260 HS, and I can agree with most commercial and owner reviews.  So I'll outline briefly the problems I've had in my 15 months of ownership, as an alert to prospective buyers, who will find similar issues with the new SX280 HS upgraded model.The pop-up flash is an annoyance, and one that has earned a few cuss words from me when it caused the camera to stall and require a reboot, effectively loosing a prime shot.  The ideal resting place for the left forefinger is atop the left corner of the camera.  If the automatic flash is on and the light low enough, the flash will emerge unexpectedly under that finger.  The finger will cause interference enough that the flash won't fully pop up.  That tells the camera to leave you a message that the camera must be turned off and then on again in order to resume operations.  I've missed many good shots as a result.  It would seem to me the flash should not use the extra mechanism space and weight that a pop-up demands, but rather should be built in to the left upper front corner like many less expensive cameras.The focus speed can be slow, especially in telephoto mode, but that is common among all digital cameras.  The newer SX280 HS has apparently sped the focus up by using a faster image processor, and that is attractive to me since I've experienced some aggravating low-light focus lag with my SX260 HS;  as I said, I like the camera in most regards and will keep it because of them, but there are these few gripes.  The same basic camera minus these cons would be my ideal all-around, go to, easy-carry camera.The diaphragm lens cover proved nearly disastrous last summer.  Most compacts, if not all, use them.  But moving from shot to shot outdoors on a vacation means not examining closely the camera lens each and every time I shut it off - I mean who really is in that habit?  Apparently a piece of dirt or small grit landed on the lens at some point, so when the cover closed, it jammed.  I had trouble getting it to close, but eventually it did, and never has jammed like that since.  I saw no debris on the lens or camera.  But some time later I was cleaning the lens and noticed two side-by-side fine scratches or nicks near the lens middle.  They don't appear to affect the images taken, but I was pretty depressed about those scratches that had to have come from that diaphragm/iris type of cover that moves across the lens surface;  after 40 years using Canon cameras, I am very careful about handling them, and the exposed lens gets near nothing that could harm it, and is carefully brushed and cleaned with specialized equipment.I was cleaning the lens again a few weeks ago and found a small white speck that wouldn't come off.  Close inspection revealed it was actually inside, between lens components!  That may be why there was a mild small halo on one image I took;  there may be more, and without further testing I can't be sure the speck is the cause.  Being only 2 months out of warranty, Canon Customer Service had me send it to Virginia for inspection and possible repair.  $13 shipping and 2 days later they inform me they don't repair such cameras, and they don't mention the debris inside the lens, only the scratches.  They offer to send me a "refurbished" or new one for $249.  No thanks.  Then their Loyalty Program offers an exchange for $158.  Hmmm.  No, just send the camera back.  If it still takes good pix with no image degradation, I'll use it or find a good buy on an SX280 HS - so far around $263, $8 more than I paid for the SX260 HS.I note one other minor glitch.  The service repair document from Canon did not enter a figure in the serial number field.  When I submitted it to begin with, I had to get that number off the original registration and box.  Why?  Because they don't engrave serial numbers anymore apparently;  they are just printed as far as I can tell, and mine had worn off enough as to not be legible on the camera.  I've got 40 year old Canon SLR's with easily read serial numbers.  Cheez.  So nobody is supposed to care if it's stolen or something.  Just like they don't repair them, they replace them.  $300 disposable cameras... what have we come to.

Reviews.Title: Great walk-about camera
Reviews.Author: Arthur Held
Reviews.Content: I use this as my walk-about pocket camera. The zoom is flippin' amazing, and the quality of the images it turns in are VERY good. It is JPEG-only (Bummer!) so you lose highlights in clouds and can't bring up shadows like you can in a RAW image, but hey, its a pocket camera, right?PROS:Amazing zoomFits in a pocketcovers its own Lens when you shut it offit has the normal canon setting modes: P/T/V/Myou can set aperture and speedHigh ISO (over 1000) looks ok.did I mention the zoom?CONS:The on/off button is a little temperamental when I want to quickly reopen it - but that could just be me.It is a-l-m-o-s-t  a little small for my older, larger hands.Summary:It's the best point-and-shoot I've ever owned. Yes, I prefer to shoot with a Canon 5DII or III. But I sure prefer slipping this guy in my pocket to lashing a DSLR around my neck. And the best camera for a photo? THE ONE YOU HAVE WITH YOU! And I always have this one.Canon - give me RAW and its perfect....

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera with a great optical zoom.
Reviews.Author: jesusismyfriend
Reviews.Content: I have a decent DSLR but I wanted a nice point and shoot for a cruise vacation I took a few weeks ago.i wanted a high powered optical zoom along with a built in GPS. I took both cameras on the cruise but I never took the DSLR out of the case. Day and night shots both were excellent. Zoomed photos were astonishing even without a tripod. Several people remarked what a nice camera when they used it to take my picture. I am not ready to sell my DSLR yet, but I won't be buying another camera for a long time.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING COMPACT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: msw
Reviews.Content: I read all of the Amazon reviews and also searched the web before purchasing this camera... and I am so glad I did.  This is the best compact camera I have ever owned.  The quality of the photos is amazing...the resolution and color quality is out of this world.  The zoom is absolutely fabulous.  The weight of the camera is quite light when considering the size of the lens.  I do not find the flash "Awkard" as stated in some reviews, and the settings options are VERY easy to use.  Once again I am thrilled with the price offered through Amazon.  Would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Fab Camera = Fab Pics!
Reviews.Author: RhondaH
Reviews.Content: After researching cameras, reading an exhaustive amount of reviews and talking to camera enthusiasts, I purchased this model for an extended European cruise.  It was very easy to use, took great pics, and was durable enough that when I smashed it down on cobblestones when I tripped it just continued to take remarkable pics.  The pics in low light conditions are very clear.  The zoom worked great - the resolution of those pics is surprisingly clear.  The clarity and color of my pics was consistently superior to my other cameras.  I did not use the video feature, because I wanted my battery to last longer.  Every day I did find that the battery needed to be replaced earlier than the manufacturer suggests, but my last task at bedtime was to charge them both up and so it was never an issue.  I have never owned a camera that I felt so consistently comfortable with!

Reviews.Title: Super Camera
Reviews.Author: gateway
Reviews.Content: Have had the camera for 4 weeks.  Took it on a 2week trip.  I have taken video with it and I have not had any squeals like some people do.  Zoom is great.  The only bad pictures were my fault and not the cameras.  The size is just right.  It will fit into my pants pocket or shirt pocked with no problem.  Haven't had to use the flash at all.  I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, a couple of usability issues
Reviews.Author: A. Benenson
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty happy with this camera - the zoom lens is awesome, it starts up quick, and the "Live" mode is a really neat idea - basically it's just a new picture-taking mode where you get just 3 sliders to adjust the picture (light/dark, cool/warm, and neutral/vivid). These make it much easier to get the color and exposure you want than fiddling with more advanced controls, although those are there for people who want them.It comes with a separate battery charger that you put the battery into; this is a nice extra when so many new cameras are cheaping out and require you to charge the battery inside the camera instead.The camera has a couple of stupid design issues - when you hold the camera, your right index finger naturally ends up on top of the power button (which feels and looks a lot like the shutter button), and your left index finger naturally ends up on top of the pop-up flash. This means that often when you want to take a photo, you'll either accidentally turn off the camera, or you'll prevent the flash from popping up (which causes an error requiring you to restart the camera).I also wish this camera had is a real panorama mode; instead it's got only "stitch assist" which helps you take a series of shots that line up. This makes it easier to convert to a panorama later if you have the right software on your PC. It's kind of puzzling that a lot of cheaper cameras already can do a better job on this.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX260 HS
Reviews.Author: ritteremr
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for several weeks now and love it. The zoom feature is one of the reasons for purchasing this particular model and was worth the research. It has a GPS feature that I have not used as of yet but am going to in the near future. I am working on family tombstones and the clarity is excellent when I add to our family tree.

Reviews.Title: Don't Let the 20x Zoom Fool You!!!
Reviews.Author: NDM
Reviews.Content: Rarely am I dissapointed with my technology purchases due to the fact that I spend so much time researching before I will ever buy. I followed my standard practice in this case when our Elph finally died on us. I wanted a small, pocket-sized, point & shoot camera with a BIG zoom and decent megapixel (MP) resolution. At the time I purchased this camera (from Best Buy), it was one of the few digital point & shoots that had an optical zoom over 12x. The 20x zoom on this camera is what sold me the most.  However, I still read reviews on this camera, but few talked about slow shutter and focus speed, or constant photo blurring, but instead most bad reviews said the camera "whined." Not sure what those persons are talking about (no whining on my SX260). Instead, here are my problems with this junker camera:- Errant auto focus (focuses not on what you're shooting at, but typically the thing behind what you're trying to shoot);- Slow shutter speed (yes, I know this is adjustable, but God help you if you try any of the auto settings);- Slow re-shoot time (even in rapid sequence or sports motion modes, you are going to experience a lag causing missed/blurred shots);- Light sensor inadequate (if you are shooting anywhere near sunrise/sunset where the light is "dim" or even indoors with flourescent lighting, you are going to get either blurry or yellow photos...or both. Doesn't matter how much you change the camera settings);- Flash (Terrible position on camera body, slow to function due to awful light sensor, has a yellow tint to it on most photos, and when it does work correctly, it still only creates "okay" photos vice "great");We took this camera to an indoor birthday party for our 7 year old son and ALL of the photos of that memorable day are HORRIBLE! Luckily for us, several of our friends took pictures of our Son and the party on their iPhones and cell phone cameras and they came out AWESOME!Recommend those who want good photos to avoid this camera at all costs...

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Steve Davis
Reviews.Content: This camera is AMAZING!  My previous camera was the canon SD750 and when the screen cracked I was more than upset.  Thus, my search for a new camera began.  After many hours of research online I came across the canon SX260 HS.  This camera is feature packed and takes wonderful pictures. With so many picture taking options I will have to play around with the camera a bit more to familiarize myself with all of the different settings.  The SX260 HS does contain an easy mode for people who simply want a point and shoot camera to produce great images.  Overall I am more than pleased with this camera, it has made me quickly forget how much I loved my old SD750.Pros:-Great zoom-Very crisp and clear images-Many features and settings to assist in obtaining the best image possible-Video recording is effortless and produces great videos-Great size for such a feature packed point and shootCons:-Seems to take some time to process after picture is taken-The GPS feature does not turn off once you power down the camera.  If you leave the GPS feature on and power down the camera it will drain the battery.-The flash that riases is placed in an inconvenient spot

Reviews.Title: Replaced Panasonic ZS7
Reviews.Author: quiske
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine camera.  I purchased it to replace a Panasonic ZS7, and it is a major improvement for both stills and video.  In particular, the Canon telephoto is much sharper at 20x than the Panasonic at 12x.  The Canon is a bit larger and heavier, but it's still a great travel camera.  Hopefully, I will eventually learn to hold it in such a way that my finger doesn't prevent the flash from opening, but this isn't a big problem for me since I use the "no flash" setting most of the time, relying on the camera's very good low light performance.  I do wish the battery lasted longer.

Reviews.Title: Happy I bouught this camera
Reviews.Author: Dianne M. Guertner
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a point and shoot camera to take on my recent trip to Florida. I didn't want to carry my big SLR camera around Disney World as I have done in the past. After researching and reading reviews I decided on the Canon Powershot SX260 HS. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. My seven year old granddaughter was even able to use the camera with ease. I can't say enough about the 20X zoom..........FANTASTIC! I love the different shooting modes. I was able to get great fireworks shots at Disney. The color and clarity of my printed pictures far exceeded my expectations. The only downside for me is this camera didn't come with a complete printed manual. It only comes with the getting started booklet. This camera has so many great features that I want to make use of all of them. I downloaded the manual CD and printed a copy. I find that easier than logging on to the computer when I want to read up on a particluar feature. All in all this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Broke down after 2 uses!!
Reviews.Author: ssbird
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon sx 260 HS in July of 2012.  I used it two times and the lens would not open.  I returned it to Canon repair who said they could only send me a refurbished model.DEFECTIVE is the word I used and they state in the warranty "no defective parts within one year."  However, look at the fine print and you'll see it is up to them to give you not a new one, just a refurbished one.  GREAT, it already doesn't work!!DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA AND EXPECT IT TO LAST.

Reviews.Title: I don't recommend - slow, distorted pics, Photo/Video lost focus often
Reviews.Author: brd9916
Reviews.Content: About my need and what I do with my camera: I am an average Joe photographer.  90% of my pics and videos are of my 2 years old daughter.  I don't/can't go in explicit technical details of a shot, all I can tell about a picture is weather I like it or not!I bought this camera due to my prior very good experience with other Canon Cameras. I had developed almost blind faith in Canon quality.  I have/had Canon SD1100IS, SD1300IS, and SX200IS. I have been most happy with SX200IS with very good picture/ Video quality and it being a mega zoom camera.I thought, and had hoped for, that SX260HS would be equal or better than SX200IS.  At least, all the technical specs are better.  However, I think Canon tried to bite too much this time, got ahead of theirselves.  They didn't need to try besting theirselves if  technology couldn't support it.  I am unhappy with this camera from day one, and honestly, can't wait to go back and get another SX200IS.  (my daughter smashed it :( )  Here are the reasons why:1. Slow response time, at least compare to SX200IS. I can't give you exact details, but I can't seem to capture quick moments of my 2 years old daughter that I was able to with SX200IS.2. Distorted, wavey pictures often. (it is called Barrel effect I think.)  Faces and objects look distorted as you go away from the center.3. HD Video zoom - didn't keep the focus while changing zoom. I got blurry, lost focus, videos often, to the point where I don't use zoom at all during video.  Just a second or two of blurry focus makes the whole clip pain to watch for the rest of your life.3. HD Video - 1080P videos look choppy. Not sure if 24FPS has anything to do with it or not, bu I have hours of 720P HD video from SX200IS and it is buttry smooth. I think 720P is good for SX260HS too, but upgraded specs of 1080P aren't good for me.4. I am finding more and more blurry, lost focused pictures.  I took about 10 pics outside in low lights, and 8 of them turned out to be blurry. I am Mad.  I am done with this camera.  I will also seriously consider buying locally to so that I can return POS like this easily, even if it costs a little bit more.There might be other reasons, but just the fact that I am not anxious to take pictures with this camera like other Canon camera's I had before makes me rate this 1 Star.edit 11/13/12: Added #4, and corrected a couple of typos.

Reviews.Title: On my second one and it's going back
Reviews.Author: CPlant
Reviews.Content: I went to the store to specifically buy this camera. I was so disappointed when the LCD screen went out after about 34 days. I contacted canon and they wanted me to send in the camera, but who wants to go days/weeks without their camera, especially around the holidays, so i took it back to the store. They exchanged it for me. I noticed that both cameras have difficulty when trying to view the photos and with the second one when i tried to delete photos it froze and eventually corrupted the files on my memory card. The camera is slow to take pics and the video quality is poor. I thought that maybe I just got a lemon the first time, but I have a feeling its just a matter of time before the new one breaks just like the first. So this one is going back too. I buy a new camera ever 1-2 years and they have all been Canon, this is the first time that I've ever really had an issue. I'll prob still buy a canon, just not this one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Max Ridgway
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a recent trip to Paris hoping that the zoom would help me get lots of memorable pictures, and I was not disappointed!  From the Eiffel Tower I was able to zoom in and capture the spires of  Sacre Coeur with perfect clarity.  I was very pleased.  Also got some beautiful images at Notre Dame with the zoom.  Some of the reviews said it wasn't good in low light, but I was able to get some spectacular pictures of the interior of Notre Dame in very low light.  The video works equally well, and didn't drain the battery as much as I had expected.  My kids love playing around with the slow motion video.  It was easy to stash in my purse while on the Metro...nice plus.

Reviews.Title: Not for everyone, but if you like power and control, give it a look
Reviews.Author: Rich "rpk46"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, and now take it places that I would have brought my digital SLR. It is compact, although a little on the heavy side, but it's capabilities make it worth it for me.First, it has nearly all of the bells and whistles of larger digital cameras, including full manual control, which is a big plus for me as a serious photographer. The optical zoom goes out to 20X, allowing me to capture distant action that I would miss with lesser compact digitals. Of course, I don't get nearly the same quality as I do with my SLR-compatible lenses, but that outfit does't fit in my pocket, either. Teamed up with a light weight tripod you can still get some great shots and have much improved "snapshots" over the usual compact digitals.If you're an avid photographer who doesn't always want to carry your heavy (and conspicuous) full outfit with you all of the time, give this a look. You WILL have this with you all of the time.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life
Reviews.Author: Susan D. Fyfe
Reviews.Content: In general I am happy with this camera.  I purchased it for a mostly business trip to Germany.  I also purchased a spare battery. During the one week I was in Germany I had to recharge each battery once and I didn't take that many pictures.  Just recently (about 3 weeks after I got back from Germany) some of my flowers were in bloom so I grabbed the camera and both batteries were dead.  Luckily, my Nikon DSLR that I haven't touched in months still had plenty of battery life.  So, if you are thinking you can just grab the camera and go, forget it.  This is not the camera for you.  You will have to plan ahead and make sure you charge a battery the night before you need the camera.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Debbie Kramer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on everyone else's reviews. Some people gave excellent technical information. So after all the reviews I settled on this camera because I wanted a great zoom lens for taking pictures of animals and scenery because I was traveling to Costa Rica. I also wanted a camera that helped with image stabilization. This camera fits my needs perfectly. I have pictures of monkeys, iguanas, sloths, crocodile, toucans, and many beach shots. I was able to get several really great pictures of the resplendent quetzal in Monteverde cloud forest. Our guide took a few shots throughout the telescope and with the naked eye and he was extremely impressed with my camera. He kept commenting what a great camera and asking if he could take more pictures. Since he could spot the birds so well I let him take a lot of pictures. Also the camera allows you to video with a record button so I have been able to capture surfers riding the waves. Family and friends are loving my pictures and videos. It makes me look like a professional.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera. LOVE it
Reviews.Author: M. McC
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera. Took it on our mission trip- the 80 digital zoom pics came out pretty good with expected grain. Basically it is a Fully functional DSL in a point and shoot package. It did nearly everything I wanted it to do. Will post sample when I get time

Reviews.Title: Update: Unacceptable battery drain
Reviews.Author: D. Wallace
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 15 months now.  For the last two months I have noticed that multiple fresh batteries will drain to zero if left in the camera after no usage in a short period of time.  In my last test, the battery lasted 12 days, with the camera only being turned on and off about 5 times to check battery level.  This is an unacceptable, as every Canon camera I've ever had, including this one until recently, has allowed for batteries to be left in for long periods of time.  I contacted Canon support, and I was told to take the battery out when the camera is not in use.  This defeats the purpose of a point and shoot household camera.  I do understand that most devices will trickle drain over time, but this is trickling too much to be useful.I have always been a loyal and satisfied consumer of Canon camera and printer products and their product support.  I was very satisfied with this camera until this point, but this is forcing me to try other brands of cameras in the future.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic photos in all settings
Reviews.Author: Bmac
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how good the pictures are from this camera.  Two features in particular stand out.  First, the zoom is amazing, and far more powerful than I would ever have expected, with complete clarity.  Secondly, there is a setting called "Discreet", and using this setting I was able to take fantastic photos in places like cathedrals, The Vatican, weddings - any place where a flash or any noise would have been a disruption.  And the photos look almost as good as they would have with a flash.  I use the automatic setting most often, and get fantastic results, but the camera offers many different options for those who want to play around with the settings.  Best camera for my use, without a doubt.  Small enough to take anywhere, yet powerful enough to give me professional quality photos.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: gregory j fleck
Reviews.Content: My wife loves her new camera. The size is perfect for her purse and lots of extra features good camera

Reviews.Title: Not what I was expecting
Reviews.Author: Original Vidiot
Reviews.Content: I had used an ELPH 300HS for years and was always amazed at how great the pictures were considering how little I know about photography and how much I simply relied on the Auto settings. After I dropped it one day and gave it a concussion, my wife suggested that if I wanted to, I should spend a little more money this time and really get the camera I wanted. She didn't have to tell me twice ! I just assumed that since the ELPH 300 was so good, spending more on another Canon would be even better and the 20X zoom was 4 times that of the previous 300HS, how could I go wrong. Strange as it seems, I just didn't think the pictures were that good, or as good as the older less expensive 300HS. I took pictures of our yard and compared them to the same exact shots from before and I just didn't think they were as good. Ultimately I found the next generation of the original 300HS, the 330HS and bought it. I took the same shots of the yard and sure enough, they were much better than the SX260. Granted, these were taken in the Auto mode but since they all were, it was a decent comparison. The 300 & 330HS also had a slightly wider lens than the SX260. The 330HS while equipped with only half the zoom range of the SX260, still had twice the zoom range of the 300HS so I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and high teach
Reviews.Author: Juniaty Wijaya
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. It is compact but does some of the expensive camera tricks. For the prices, you cannot beat the features and the bulkiness of professional camera. I took it for my trip to Alaska and love the pictures taken.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot SX260
Reviews.Author: Christopher D. Stanton
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to celebrate our first grandchild and have loved how easy it is to use---great quality and value !

Reviews.Title: Works great, takes nice photos
Reviews.Author: Dogmom44
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, takes nice photos and shorts movies.  Lightweight with fairly long battery life.  The low light feature is very good to still capture nice pictures in low light without having to use a flash.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Chuck Layman
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this camera.  The picture quality is impressive and the hd video is incredible.  What I think l like the most is its portability.  Its a professional level camera without being big and bulky.

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: JimD "Jim"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful walk-around camera.  I've had it for a couple of years and it's the best pocket camera that I've owned.  The 20x optical zoom does a great job.  I've printed 8x10's and they are sharp.  Decent 3200 ISO for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Scott Morton
Reviews.Content: Canon owes me - I have 4 friends that have bought this unit over the past 6 months after trying mine.  The image stabilization and low light is phenomenal.  The color saturation and light balance is very good.  And, after a safari to Africa with friends who had 25 lbs of camera and lenses, guess whose shots everyone wants?  That's right - the ~$200 camera out performed them all with closer views thanks to the 20 to 1 zoom (I will buy their 30 to 1 when it comes out), clearer images due to image stabilization and lens quality, and better colors due to the big chip and Canon software.  Did I mention that it weighs only a half a pound and fits in the pocket of my pants and coats?  And of course, I always had it with me cause it is so easy to have along.  We have all the unexpected shots as well!!  I can have it out of my pocket (not in the backpack and have to choose a lens), zoomed and focused in a few seconds while the big camera guys are still getting their bag down!  All my friends feel the same about theirs - a real winner.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: cynthia pea ch
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize the memory card didn't come with the camera - my mistake.  When I did get my sd card and used the camera, it was flawless and so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: BEST point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Jeep Girl "Crafter"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes great photos.  The zoom is fantastic and I can zoom in on a fly on a deers nose 300 yards away.  It's easy to use, easy hookup to my computer.  I just take out the SD card and slide it into my laptop, voila...photos.  I, at one time, wanted a smaller camera but I have yet to find a camera will all the features and zoom this one has.  I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Obsidiona
Reviews.Content: Researched cameras extensive before selecting this make and model as a gift to my wife who has several non-digital slr cameras with some expensive lenses for a variety of shooting needs and conditions. This camera is always available and readily at hand and is a lot less expensive as far as the costs of ending up with a finished print. She still has her other cameras for extensive photography sessions or planned projects but this one gives her unlimited opportunities for that "perfect photo if only I had my camera with me situations".

Reviews.Title: This Camera is for everybody! ...
Reviews.Author: BlackPudding
Reviews.Content: I always remember a professional photographer telling me that anybody who is not a professional photographer should always invest in buying a good camera.  The reason being, a professional photographer could use almost any camera to take a good picture; the non-professional needs the help of the camera.  After reviewing the pics taken by a friend and complimenting her on her skill she referred me to the Canon Powershot SX260.  Of course I googled the reviews and immediately bought it as a birthday gift for my daughter who travels a lot and was always complaining about her "messed-up" pics.  She LOVES her Canon Powershot SX260!

Reviews.Title: PowerShot
Reviews.Author: mikeshouse
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I purchased it because I was going to Europe and wanted the flexibility of the 20x zoom lens. I was not disappointed as it operated flawlessly. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect 'Always Available' Camera
Reviews.Author: Bill Was "Rural Alaskan"
Reviews.Content: I love this small but functional camera especially as its priced to be easy to afford.  I finally have the perfect 'fill in' camera between my Canon EOS Rebel T3i and my cell phone camera.  Living in Alaska there is always something worth taking a picture of and the cell camera just doesn't have the optics or range of settings while the Rebel is a bit bulky to carry everywhere I go.  The PowerShot SX260 is a great way to fill this gap!  I have yet to try the video but then I largely purchased the unit to handle still images...

Reviews.Title: I Like Canon Cameras
Reviews.Author: LAN Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a feature-rich camera.As others have written to get the best results you will want to spend some time with the manual. There are many, MANY options. If you have a Canon Digital SLR many of the controls will be familiarOne of the reasons I chose this camera is because I have a Canon Rebel SLR. And I had a venerable A-1 35mm SLR, "back in the day", so I thought that would help with my learning curve.I even have a Canon PowerShot D10. But I wanted a longer lens in something smaller than the Rebel.I have been very pleased with the SX260. Even when I shot in AUTO because I was in a hurry I often got satisfactory results for a point-and-shoot. They look fine on FaceBook but I would want to blow them up to 24x36.What are you trying to do?This is NOT a professional grade camera. So don't expect to shoot for poster-sized prints.And here's the BIGGEST tip, if you are using that 20x lens think seriously about a tripod. Camera shake is the biggest cause of disappointing photos.WARNING!!!  --  DO NOT ORDER WITH 16 GB CARDOK, it COULD be my camera. Or it COULD be my card but they did not play well together. TWICE I lost all the photos on the card BEFORE I had backed them up. (Careless, not slow-learner.)There has been NO problem with smaller cards over the past several months.

Reviews.Title: Great shots!
Reviews.Author: Chelsea Vaughan
Reviews.Content: This camera takes BEAUTIFUL photos. Even in low light the shots are crystal clear.  It's a little bulkier than I would like, but it still fits in my standard camera case.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: PrettyPicky
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera and I try to buy the latest camera every year and this camera is fast and takes a great picture. I use the auto mode so I just push the button and forget it and I get great pics.

Reviews.Title: Solid compact camera and better than expected photo quality
Reviews.Author: Michael Dixon "Composer/Songwriter"
Reviews.Content: Although I recently got my first smartphone (don't judge!) that takes excellent photos, I still prefer a good quality compact digital camera. We've owned Canon digital cameras since the days of 2 megapixels! This 12 megapixel camera is small but surprisingly rugged and well built. It turns on faster than anything I've ever owned. I don't mess with many of the presets and typically use the easy modes. I have to say I am impressed. Low-light is always an issue with these cameras, but this camera really handles it well. The key, of course, it keeping it as still as possible. There's very little grain in low-light photos with this camera, compared to our previous model. The GPS feature, when it works, is nice…especially when I import the photos into iPhoto on my Mac. It plots the photos on a world map for easy location of where photos were taken. But if the camera is only on for a brief time, it doesn't have time to get its location (especially indoors) and doesn't record that GPS data on the photo.I've recorded a little video on this camera and it was decent. I have a dedicated video camera for HD video recording of home movies, and this camera just can't compete with that. But in a pinch, it captures better than anything I've had in the past (still cameras).This was my first SX model. In the past, we've had the A series of Canon cameras, and owned a G2 years ago. I think this SX model comes really close to the G series in terms of start-up speed and rapid photo taking.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera - excellent optical zoom
Reviews.Author: FishFishFish
Reviews.Content: love this camera!! i've had the digital Elph series camera before, and this was a great upgrade from my older model. the optical zoom works so well that i was able to get printable face shots of my sister at her graduation. she was sitting on the stadium field, and i was at almost the top row of the bleachers in a standard sized football stadium. very impressive clarity. has enough features for an intermediate photographer to be useful, and menus are easy to figure out. i feel like i still have some features i have yet to intellectually understand or utilize, but works great for what i typically use it for (family photos, and close ups of still life - at a distance of 2 feet). and im glad i still have some room for my photography skill growth with the options the camera offers. the owners manual comes in digital form - so if you like to read on paper you'll have to print it out, but thats a small minus to an overall excellent product. i would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Would buy again.
Reviews.Author: Harry Reckinrod
Reviews.Content: I don't know anything about photography but I do enjoy capturing memories and this camera does that every time. It's compact and affordable while still taking beautiful photos.

Reviews.Title: Great shots, poor flash design.
Reviews.Author: BTaubs714
Reviews.Content: This camera takes absolutely wonderful pictures, and the zoom is unreal.  Can be at a stadium in the last row and take pictures of athletes or performers faces.  Flash pops up out of the camera though and startles people, which makes me fear some one will drop it as it is right in the natural holding position.  Also, its a bit large, but so much better than your camera phone

Reviews.Title: Love the Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Roger Cartee
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it as much as I would like but the pictures I have taken so far have been excellent. The zoom feature was great when I took pictures of the Canadian Geese on the lake and the Bald Eagle flying across the lake.The camera is easy to handle, not too big and not too small but just right. My wife likes it and she needs simple and along with great features it is easy to use. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with only a few tiny flaws
Reviews.Author: crystallized
Reviews.Content: This camera came with everything except the software CD. But I don't really care since I never use that crap software they always stick with cameras anyway.Strangely, this camera also came with a continental European plug-type power cord for the charger. There is also a North American plug-type, so no worries. However, the North American cord is only an inch in length, which is really annoying because most outlets are not going to be right against the floor or table, which means you'll have to sit the camera on top of books or something to be able to charge it. The continental european cord is 5 inches long, which makes me think it's the original cord that belongs to this camera and they just stuck a really cheap and really short US cord in the box in addition.The camera itself is in mint condition and works great. It's been several years since I last updated my camera so this is exactly the kind of camera I wanted, minus the horribly short US power cord. I might try to find a longer power cord to buy for the charger. It's ridiculous to have such a short cord. It's going to be really inconvenient for traveling. Search for "figure 8 power cord" to find longer cords for just $3.Camera has literally zero built-in memory, so don't forget to buy a memory card! My old camera had 15MB built-in memory, which was enough for about 5 pictures. This camera won't save any pictures at all without a memory card inserted.The popup flash is kinda annoying since my finger is often grasping the camera in that location, but I suppose I'll get used to it eventually.I haven't played with the different settings yet, but just taking some pictures fresh out of the box, it's a decent camera with high-def pics. I'm not very impressed with its video quality, but hey I intend to use it as a camera, not a camcorder, so I don't care.

Reviews.Title: High quality, small size
Reviews.Author: teacher4ever
Reviews.Content: Perfect size. Easy to use. It can zoom in on far-away subjects and take nice, clear photos. It is easy to manage the pictures after they are taken.

Reviews.Title: Very Handy and Great Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Papps
Reviews.Content: Superb image quality in a very small package. It won't replace a DSLR but if you need a versatile travel camera and don't want to lug around a lot of camera equipment this camera is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera, takes great pictures, easy to use, compact, we use this camera all the time, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: the sx260 is a great point-and-shoot camera, pic quality is terrific and so is the battery life, I recommend it to everyoneI've also been using the video and that is good too (visually and sound wise)

Reviews.Title: Cannon SX260HS 12.1 MP Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Johnny Vo "Boeing"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very satisfied with the sturdy structure of the camera. Its appearance was pretty and the pictures came out beautifully. We received it right before the wedding of our family member. All were expected in the box when it came. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Maria V
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace the same camera I stupidly dropped and broke. Lesson learned is to definitely buy a small case to carry the camera. For ease of use this camera is great. The lens retracts closed and flat which I love. The 20x digital zoom is great. My only complaint is the somewhat slow reaction time when taking a flash photo. Photos themselves are sharp and colors are great. Great little camera for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great Video & Photos
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Kneeland
Reviews.Content: I had to order this to film several videos. The videos on this camera are amazing - so clear and vibrant. We were so happy with them, and the photos are also exceptionally good!

Reviews.Title: More sophisticated than my elph Canon powershot SD900 something
Reviews.Author: MARIA D.
Reviews.Content: I basically chose this camera because am partial towards canon products.  Now I like them small, light and point and shoot which is practical for travelling. If I am not running out of time to study its other features, I will study its manual mode.  I also chose to buy this because of its 25mm wide angle lens and its its high telephoto capacity.  On top of that it is capable of making 30 minute movies.  I noted that I can also put together different still pictures to make a video.  It is easy to operate, at least the auto smart mode because I have had a canon powershot before.  I may have to review my photography lessons though on exposure, etc to be able to do better on how to operate the manual mode. The color gray is perfect too to my taste.  I noted too the microphone in making a movie to catch the sounds. I love my new camera and it takes sharp pictures.  Can't wait to use it at the cruise although tonight we will have picture-taking at my bf's house.  I only got to spend a few hours to tinker with the camera and get myself familiarized with it relatively.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Plainfield, IL Mom
Reviews.Content: Used this in Europe this summer, takes great photos.  There is a bit of a learning curve on this and I had to look up many things like taking panoramic photos but once you read about it it it pretty easy.  So it is not overly intuitive but you can figure it out.  I also LOVE the GPS function, when loaded on my ipad I can see the London photos separate from the Nice or Paris photos etc.  That is the one function that I would not want to give up or turn off on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: A. James
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!!!! Bought two far so!!! I would definitely recommend. It is very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: As good as advertised
Reviews.Author: Anwar Ali "dustypace"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon 2 months ago after contemplating for several months, mainly due to expecting a price drop. Knowing what I know now I should have picked it up upon initial release. Here's why:My previous 2 point and click were Nikon Coolpix, specifically the S8100. After damaging it in January, I needed a replacement and targeted the SX260. The Canon delivers superior images to the S8100, even at less image size.Pros:'Crisp photos in numerous levels of lighting'Zoom shots rarely if ever have blurs, even with figure in motionCons:'Slight delay after taking a shot'Record feature could be more intuitive'Flash off/on feature takes time to understand'Still pricey but best in the price range regardless

Reviews.Title: fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Bought it for a trip to the Grand Canyon and am really really impressed! Lots of features, great zoom and easy to use, thanks Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Connie Dyall
Reviews.Content: This is a great compact camera.  The quality and detail the pictures takes are wonderful!  Would recommend to anyone looking for a light weight camera witih high quality output.

Reviews.Title: Love that RED!
Reviews.Author: Portia Baker
Reviews.Content: Great little camera that will easily fit into my purse. It makes really good pictures and is simple enough for me to understand most of its functions. And, I love the color...everyone comments on it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Virginia L. Pezzuti
Reviews.Content: Bough it for my wife and she loves it. Likes the zoom it has and photo quality. Her froiends want to buy it as well after seeing her results.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: Maggie Bouldin
Reviews.Content: I have had Sony digital cameras for years but this one leaves those in the dust.  The zoom is impressive, the clarity is great, and the HD video is fantastic – yet all this comes in a delightfully small package.  I also like the color options.  There's really nothing about it I don't like, and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Awesome pictures!!! East to use!
Reviews.Author: Snoho mama
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I bought one for my son to take to Africa and liked it so much, I bought one too. Incredible zoom and easy to use. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: Good heavy duty quality.
Reviews.Author: User
Reviews.Content: It was made in Japan.  Very long zoom works well.  Great movie options with HD.  Rechargeable battery lasts long.  Nice color.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl
Reviews.Content: I always buy Cannon cameras because of the quality photos they take!!  The zoom on this one is amazing!!  It's amazing how clear things are while so far away.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Pumpf
Reviews.Content: So far, this camera is everything we hoped it would be.  If we could take the time to learn all the bells and whistles, we'd probably like it even more!

Reviews.Title: amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: Joanne "zojojo2"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so awesome. It even does some things that my husband's big Minolta digital SLR does.  I took and pic of my son's cannon ball into pool and caught him in mid air......with no motion blur!!  Still learning about all the cool stuff it does, but I really love that it's easy to use, and you can do custom settings for the advanced user.  I got it as a gift and would absolutely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Little PHD Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Scott
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to upgrade her from an older PowerShot.  She has used it with almost an odd fervor since unwrapping it.  Sandisk cannot make enough Class 10 SD cards to keep up with her voracious appetite for clicking.  It takes great pictures for a camera in its price range.  She especially loves the rapid fire feature and the HD video recording feature.  This camera has been a real asset on our vacations and for chronically the first year of our youngest child's life.  Highly recommended.  Just be sure you buy a Class 10 card for it to unlock its full potential.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie Anderson
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures.  But I am still getting use to the flash popping up under my finger.  You need to train yourself how to hold the camera.

Reviews.Title: nice upgrade from my Canon SD790IS
Reviews.Author: Ima Weiner
Reviews.Content: I am an avid point-and-click photographer, I love love love documenting the human experience but have yet to take a lesson or get serious about photography (meaning I am too broke to afford an SLR and don't want to tote it around anyway). I wanted an inexpensive camera I can fit in my pocket to capture all the fun we have roaming around the great outdoors of Montana. This camera meets all my needs and takes a much faster and slightly better quality image than my previous Canon, the SD790 IS (which I have basically destroyed by throwing it in the bottom of my purse or backpack with no protection. The casing eventually starts to come apart, who knew!?). I LOVE the fun photo options and color, light, and shutter speed variables it allows you to change. I still wish I could take panoramas without having to stitch them together in a program, but I had that complaint with my old Canon too. It is a little awkward getting used to the flash placement but I love that the flash doesn't overpower the pictures and you have the option to set how strong the flash strength is. A week into the purchase and I am still learning all the functions, there are a lot of neat things like smooth skin pictures, low light pictures, vivid color, etc... I found out in my messing around that it can take a few seconds of movie with each picture and make a highlight reel "movie" of your experience with audio... especially hilarious when you didn't know you were recording. Seems like a quality camera and I have no regrets with my purchase. I bought a little cheap case and hopefully manage to be more careful with this one than the last one :)

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M. Griffin
Reviews.Content: This camera is just perfect for me. Optics are very good quality, the 20x zoom is incredibly useful, and form factor is convenient and comfortable.  The ability to manually control the settings is a huge benefit, though I've had problems figuring out some extreme situations (outdoor, moonlit seascape was a fail).  Also admit to loving the color (green).  Wonderful 12.1 MP camera!

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: vicki wright
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this camera. I am older and have issues with shaking hands. this camera allows me to take great pictures!

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: MR "mr_1"
Reviews.Content: One major flaw - the flash is located top left (a usual place, I know) but the camera is very thin, the top of the flash is also the natural place to hold the camera. Not a problem if the flash is off. But - if you're trying to change any settings and accidentally hit the flash button (trust me, it's REALLY easy to do this) then your finger blocks the flash and you have to re-start the camera before taking any pictures.Otherwise - I love the camera. The pictures are great, sharp, clear, and bright. I'm still getting used to the dial focus (which rings around the buttons for flash and some presets...hence the ease of accidentally hitting the flash button). The color select is FANTASTIC. It can be used as a point and shoot - or you can fiddle with the settings endlessly. It's light, fits in a pocket, convenient.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Viray "HappyLady"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good camera to take shots of people and our travels.  A family member used to sell cameras and kept pointing me to Canons for their color quality.  I'm an amateur photographer but use a camera daily to take family and nature shots.  I am LOVING the color quality of the pictures I'm getting.  It's true that the flash pops out where you might place your fingers but it's NO BIG DEAL as it's easy to get used to.  It is also true that when light is ideal, you'll get better videos.  I'm blown away by the zoom quality even in dim light.  You get a bang for your buck with this camera and I'm SO glad I chose this particular one.

Reviews.Title: Fantatic Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Terry A. Bass
Reviews.Content: I use only point & shoot cameras and mainly for travel.  I have a wonderful Lumix camera with 24X zoom but at over 1.5 lbs that means a shoulder mounted carrying case --- not good for hiking or on crowded city streets. The SX260 is just what I wanted for travel --- light weight, belt loop mounted using case, wonderful images using Auto all the time. The camera gets very good reviews, even #1 in Consumer Reports for a super-zoom in its most current version --- the SX280 which adds only Wi-fi.  I have a friend who is an optics expert and owns many cameras including DSLRs. When he checked out my SX260 he bought the SX280 and says it's the best small camera he has ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a trip to Washington, DC.  The pictures are beautiful!  It has a great zoom.  It fits in my purse.  I also have taken it to Russia and Ireland.  I have recommended it to several friends who have raved about their purchase. The picture quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Small, but mighty.
Reviews.Author: C Farris
Reviews.Content: I have been using the camera on my iPhone for most photos for the last year because it is easy to carry and always available. This little camera will fit nicely in my pocket or purse, so that I am ready for that shot. A good friend, who was a photographer, once told me, "The best camera will only take a good photo if you take the camera with you." This camera will go where you don't want to carry a larger camera and take high quality shots.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Noah
Reviews.Content: I love this product so much it's very good and it's just good and I like good because good is good

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: Frozen in North Pole
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Great zoom lense, takes awesome pictures and they got the bugs out from the earlier models. Power button was moved and the flash does not jump up and hit your finger like the previous model.I would definetly reccommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Debbie K.
Reviews.Content: I love the of this camera.  It had features usually found on SLR cameras.  Live the ease of use, the clear crisp pictures and that you can  take pictures in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: shopper34
Reviews.Content: Another great point and shoot camera from Canon. My wife carries this in her purse for pictures of the kids. It takes great pictures and I like the GPS feature.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: fwpc
Reviews.Content: So far I really like this camera.  Have not learned yet how to work all the functions but the pictures print out beautifully.  Am very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jose Rivera
Reviews.Content: Just took the camera on vacation, no complains, the camera meets all my expectations.  The larger zoom comes in handy and the overall size of the camera is perfect for traveling.

Reviews.Title: So Easy, yet so full of Features...
Reviews.Author: M. H. Chaffin "RAMBLIN' WRECK"
Reviews.Content: Took this camer,a on a road trip to Utah and got some great pictures of Zion, Bryce, Chaco Canyon, Canyon de Chelles, Grand Canyon etc.  Looking at the pictures helps me re-live my fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!  Great value!
Reviews.Author: sunny "sunning in the  tropics"
Reviews.Content: I had another Canon Power Shot before and was happy with it.  Unfortunately I lost it.  So I did my research and came to the conclusion of buying another more up to date Canon Power Shot.  I was not disappointed!  The colors and clarity of the pictures are great.  The camera does reduce movements which will make your pictures sharper.  The only flaw the camera has is that the pop up flash is located at the very top where we are all used to holding it.  You must remember not to put your finger on the pop flash preventing the flash from popping up.  Honestly you will get used to not putting your finger on pop flash.

Reviews.Title: Best Value
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera for my Digital Imaging class that would take great pictures but not break the bank. The Canon SX260 has exceeded expectations and kept me shooting after I got my A. I can't imagine a better camera at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX260
Reviews.Author: Sports Nut "GA"
Reviews.Content: While i am an DSLR photographer, this Canon compliments our equipment for those days when those heavy SLR's are just not appropriate.  However, the SX260  pictures are outstanding.  The video is easy to use with great resolution. Outstanding pictures!!! Fits easily in your pocket or clipped to your belt loop with the TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: H. Yan
Reviews.Content: It has very clear picture.Just one improvement:The flash light: It forces my finger to move out when it pops up. And it has error message when the flash light is slightly blocked (by my finger). I have to restart the camera again. This is very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!
Reviews.Author: Cathy Sherer
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this camera.  Nice size - nice quality pictures - easy to operate.  I also have a Canon Sure Shot and the PowerShot takes much better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos!
Reviews.Author: Nana
Reviews.Content: This was very much worth the purchase.  the pictures are beautiful and the compact size is perfect.  I would do it all over again!!

Reviews.Title: Love canon products
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Cornelius
Reviews.Content: Great camera with the usual canon quality and lots of nice features for the novice photographer. I chose this camera after much research and reading reviews on Amazon.  It is the perfect size for me, compact but not too small with a nice size LCD screen and zoom lens.  My printed photos turned out beautiful but also show up nicely on the LCD screen to review.  All in all it is a great camera for the price. I would recommend it to anyone.  Charlotte

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX260
Reviews.Author: odki.dave
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take on trip to Alaska and the reviews were very good. I have found nothing that would lead me to believe that this was not a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Mary Goldthorpe
Reviews.Content: I like the camera but without a guide included it is cumbersome to have to read the instructions on the computer and then practice using it.  Also, the battery has had to be charged twice and we haven't really used it much.  We certainly are happy that we purchased a spare battery. We are taking a trip to Alaska and wanted the convenience of a small camera that would take good quality pictures and it fits that parameter.  Haven't yet tried to take any movies but we liked that feature as well.

Reviews.Title: Very high quality
Reviews.Author: Dani
Reviews.Content: I always loved canon, but this product is amazing. I cannot believe the quality of the photos. If you are looking for the right point and shoot camera, look no further.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sx260 hs
Reviews.Author: spook
Reviews.Content: I just got my new camera from Amazon. I love the auto focus feature and the quality of the pictures so far are great even at distances. I had bought my daughter a canon PowerShot for Christmas and was amazed at the quality of the recording of my grandsons soccer game! So when my old camera died after less than a couple of years use, The Canon PowerShot was the only one I looked at to purchase. Of course I had to have the 1080 pixel instead of the 720 pixel I got her so my Video quality should be better...Thanks Amazon

Reviews.Title: Great Zoom, NIce size, Very Good Overall Camera
Reviews.Author: David Veronesi
Reviews.Content: June 2013.  Great camera for Under $300!!I have not had this camera long at all.  Have not taken it on a trip yet, but have played around with it locally.  I did quite a bit of research on camera's before purchasing.  If you want a combination of good optical zoom with compact size... you should consider this camera!!Flash is a little annoying (pops up where your finger wants to rest; But I can get used to it).I really wish it had a view finder.  I will see how the display performs at the beach in 2 weeks!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Me2
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, fast and affordable!! Excellent pictures for the price range!!!I'm not sure how anyone could give this a low rating.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Megan Nichols
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.I was hesitant to get another small camera, but this one is super clear and has a great zoom!! Love the size also!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Kris Fellner
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband and chose it instead of a SLR because he likes to keep it in his pocket.  This camera takes amazing pictures!  It has an awesome zoom on it and I am still shocked at the range of the flash on it.  I have enlarged several pics that he has taken and they look great!  I would recommend this camera to anyone.  I don't at all feel like I compromised by not buying the more expensive SLR as this suits him perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: D. Dimauro
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice. Most of my photographs are of my grandchildren and they both participate in sports so the zoom lens comes in very handy. I'm able to get close shots even from across the field.The clarity and color of the images are very good. It has a mind boggling variety of modes to choose from. The separate video button is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Shashank
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a point and shoot camera, then this is a camera to consider. The thing I love about this is the amazing wide angle lens. You can take some beautiful images. Granted the image quality at night time is not great, I guess thats what you get for a point and shoot. The overall image quality is great. Good color and saturation. I would say its bit on the softer side when you see for sharpness and also the noise is a bit more compared to nikon point and shoot. 20x zoom comes in handy. The thing that I love the most about this camera is the super awesome wide angle of view. Great for travel, landscape photography during day time. May not be good for portraits and night photography.

Reviews.Title: Functionality is great
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Romanoski
Reviews.Content: Pictures are clear and concise, the camera is light, compact, and easy to pack, and the cd and manual were informative.

Reviews.Title: Terrific little camera!
Reviews.Author: bee
Reviews.Content: We took this camera with us on our Hawaiian cruise. It's lightweight, so  easy to use and it took great pictures too!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: Love how close I can get to an object that is far away and not have to be up closed to it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Speech Prof "spchprof"
Reviews.Content: I have owned four Canon cameras and have loved every one of them. I purchased this one because it's smaller and easier for traveling. The pictures turned out great.

Reviews.Title: Optical Zoom is the story
Reviews.Author: Gary Moore
Reviews.Content: Although the camera is a bit bigger and heavier than some point and shoot, the optical zoom gives this camera a great advantage.  Have enjoyed getting to know the zoom's limits and catching candid shots from a distance.  The flash carries much further than my other point and shoot.  Battery life has not been a problem.  Not sure what the problem is in have pictures deleted automatically while downloading but it may be the age of my computer software and the new flip view of today's cameras.  Am happy with the choice of the Canon PowerShot SX \260

Reviews.Title: Great GPS and Zoom Range - Wonderful overall
Reviews.Author: Bichael
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned ordering this camera as some were quite negative about it.  My experience has been very good.  The GPS works flawlessly and bringing in the photos to Aperture on my iMac, the placement of the photos on the map is perfect. I haven't yet tried the GPS log but will soon.  The optical zoom range (20-1 with IS) is nothing short of spectacular and the pictures when blown up remain as sharp as to be expected with a 12 megapixel camera.  Some have complained about the placement of the popup flash but while it is not optimal, it is easy to get used to.  Others have complained about the battery life but this is quite manageable, especially if you carry a few extra batteries (which are quite inexpensive).  I've noticed battery life issues only when having GPS logging on and this is to be expected as you are running the GPS in the camera even when it is otherwise off.  If you have a problem with that, just turn off the GPS logging.The controls are very simple, once you understand them.  It took me a while (I had to look at the documentation -- imagine that) to figure out that the little ring around the function set has a purpose as a wheel.  One feature that I especially love is the dedicated movie button.  I have missed too many movie opportunities in the past while twisting a dial on other cameras to get to the movie function, often not quite getting to that function.  And also the problems of then forgetting I'm in movie mode when I try to shoot photos again.One thing that is important to know is that this is not the lightest of cameras.  It's nowhere near as heavy or bulky as a DLSR but it is a bit larger and noticeably heavier that a typical point and shoot.  But, then there is more in there -- the GPS and the very long optical zoom -- a small price for those features.

Reviews.Title: sx260
Reviews.Author: Carol E. Golla "mountainmama"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a month and so far it has met my expectations. Pictures are clear and even though my hands shake sometimes the photos are not blurred.

Reviews.Title: Excellent and affordable travel camera
Reviews.Author: Old country doctor
Reviews.Content: The SX260 is my sixth Canon camera over the past 15 years. The nice feature of buying within the Canon camera family is that my learning curve is short. I purchased this camera two days before a trip to France. The camera is light weight, with an impressive zoom, reasonably small and fits into my back pocket and it made some great pictures. I did read other reviews prior to my purchase. And, I agree that the location of the flash is inconvenient. Nonetheless, I have worked out a solution. If I put the camera dial on the "p" setting, then all I needed to do was to set the ASA.  I took many night pictures of the Eiffel Tower while I was on a moving tour boat. I set the ASA to 1600 and the flash never deployed and the pictures were perfect for my needs. And, as previous reviewers have mentioned, the Garmin- style geographic locator must be turned off or the battery life will suffer dramatically.This is a great camera for travelers and the cost was just north of $200.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Alex E. Neuburger
Reviews.Content: Small and light with very good versatile lens. I like the pop-up flash. Screen is very clear, controls well placed and photos are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos
Reviews.Author: Vlo
Reviews.Content: I love my camera!! This is a little bulkier than some others, but it takes great photos. I took it with me on a cruise. The zoom is amazing. I love it and it also took great selfies! :) lol

Reviews.Title: Yay!
Reviews.Author: Yoona
Reviews.Content: This point and shoot camera is awesome! I primarily used a Canon DSLR and really liked the photo quality and colors captured, but couldn't carry around the huge camera everywhere, so I decided to get this smaller point and shoot camera. I love it! I carry it around with me everywhere and the effects available on the camera are fun to play around with (fish eye effect is hilarious).

Reviews.Title: Love the Zoom!
Reviews.Author: Love to Travel
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera for three or four months now, and it takes great photos. Two cautions: First, it is heavier than some cameras in its class, though not terrible; and the weight is a good trade-off to get the amazing zoom capability. Second, I usually carry the camera in my pocket and have learned to check the dial to make sure the camera is on the right setting before I start shooting, as  the dial moves easily. The good news is, as you turn the setting dial, the screen tells you what setting you are on (ex: automatic, manual, live, video, etc.) and what it does, so you can make adjustments quickly and easily, without squinting in the dark to confirm the setting. I would definitely recommend this little camera.

Reviews.Title: A vast improvement over my previous Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Duane Sparks "Duane"
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a Canon A560 digital camera about 18 months ago.  It took beautiful photos that printed out like art work on my Canon Pixma.  For vacations, photos taken around the house, portraits, action shots in the yard...it was perfect.  But, it lacked one highly needed feature for our family.  It could not take quality photos at a distance, particularly indoors in artificial light.  We attend gymnasium events and auditorium events to watch the kids in action.  All the photos taken in "zoom" would be blurry or totally out of focus or so grainy they were useless.I spoke to Canon tech support and they explained that one major reason was due to the camera having digital zoom rather than optical zoom.  I had my doubts, but because these are such important photos for us to have I bought the Canon PowerShot SX260 HS.  WOW!  WHAT A DIFFERENCE!  The guy at tech support has given us a gift that we will treasure for many years...photos...memories...fun.  The optical zoom removes all the problems we had.  You can still get minor blurring at the most distant zoom setting, but they are useable even at that point.  Taking photos in a auditorium of a children's concert from 50 feet away proved no problem at all.  Super sharp pictures!Great camera for a moderate price.

Reviews.Title: SX 260 went to Disney.
Reviews.Author: C. C.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera and received it several days before leaving for Disney.  Not much time to learn the ins and outs.  It performed well and I was pleased with the shots I took with the exception of the fireworks.  I'm sure I will do better next time.  Zoom is super.  Pictures of the electric parade were awesome. With the 12 mp, cropping is excellent to bring in an even closer view.  Though the time between shots is faster than my six year old Olympus, it is still not fast enough to suit me.  I'm sure that will come in future generations of cameras. I like the small cameras with powerful zoom and big mp.  Not into carrying a big SLR around anymore so this camera fits the bill for right now.Am pleased with the camera.  I take a lot of shots of my dog, flowers, scenery and grandkids.  So far it has worked out very well.

Reviews.Title: Simply the best
Reviews.Author: Jader Rodrigues da Fonseca
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking on cost benefit and quality that it could give me. I thought it would not be so good, but as I was looking for something good and reasonably priced, I decided to buy it. The fact is that I was surprised with the machine, simply the best I've had so far, if we talk in size and segment (point and shoot). I strongly recommend this machine.Pros: The battery life is excellent, takes sharp pictures with vivid colors and no ghosting.Cons: so far, no.

Reviews.Title: A solid choise
Reviews.Author: marshall L. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot SX260 HS 12.1 MP 20X apparently has a metal case as it feels quite solid and meant to last.  It is quite flexible and seems designed to do everything capably that I ask of it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot sx260
Reviews.Author: Gregory J. Walkley
Reviews.Content: Camera is great.  The different functions on the camera are a great feature and it take really good photos. Would definitely recommend to any amateur photographer.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Rock Man"
Reviews.Content: I don't care what the ads say, you don't get great pictures from your phone, especially an i-phone. There are times you want a quality shot and i believe everyone needs a camera.  This one is small, big on features and a great Product for the price.  It take almost as good of picture as the fancy SLRs, but muc better than any other point and shot I've seen.  I don't think you'll be sorry owning one of these.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Carol from Florida
Reviews.Content: My old Canon SD750 died and I ordered this one as a replacement. The zoom is so much better and I've been very happy with the quality of the photos.  It's a little bigger and heavier than my old camera, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to see and easy to use
Reviews.Author: A. Lincoln "Colorado"
Reviews.Content: The LCD screen on this camera is large and easy to see. The controls are logical and do not require enormous amount of time to learn. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: Sophia
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a compact camera with an far reaching zoom, this will do the job.  Good battery life, and light weight.

Reviews.Title: SIMPLY AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Jimmy V
Reviews.Content: This camera is incredible! It takes awesome pictures and the resolution at night is superb! A PERFECT SCORE OF 5!

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Sylvia McKewon
Reviews.Content: My dad wanted a camera and it needed a good zoom and wide angle.  The HD video was a plus.  His first real adventure was to an air show and the camera took great pictures.  A winner for him :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Herrera
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, the zoom is amazing and it takes great pictures. I just wish the battery would last longer, esepcially when you record video. I think if you decide to get this camera make sure you get multiple back up batteries. It was shipped in a timely manner and I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Lisa E. Dunlap "So many books, so little time"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera! I have a Nikon D3100 DSLR, which is too bulky for my tastes for a lot of picture taking on the go, and I have been very pleased with Canon's point and shoot cameras. I used this one the first time at our local butterfly show and took beautiful pictures that I am thrilled with. Also  used it for pictures of the kids going to prom--again, took some wonderful portraits and candid shots. It's very easy to use, and just the right weight in my hand, although maybe too heavy for your pocket. It does use a rechargeable battery and not AAs.

Reviews.Title: Best to lug around... for quality.
Reviews.Author: Paige Polley "Stardust_007"
Reviews.Content: You can't carry your DSLR around your neck all the time. This is the least bulky (compact) of the Canon cameras you can buy with the best quality of pictures. Very handy for those instant/quick shots and easy to carry around in the pocket or purse. Flash placement is on the wrong spot, though, where we usually touch when holding it up with both hands to take a pic... so the flash tries to come up (in low-light environment) but you're pushing down on it. You would end up needing a re-take, & sometimes you can't afford to do that, or it's too late. Otherwise, 'love the video mode in full HD!

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Santina Dian Metasari Poesoko
Reviews.Content: i love this cameras. compare with the price and the result picture is is a big deal. easy to use and handy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera !
Reviews.Author: ROBYSMOM
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Really really really great clear crisp pictures.  It has an 80x zoom and those pictures and great too.  I used it at to take photos of Kenny Chesney on stage at the Houston Rodeo from the top level - and it looks like you are 10 feet away - still a good clear picture.  I take tons of photos now.  It has a live mode so I was able to use it during my daughters high school drill team performance without having to have the flash and could zoom in on her alone.  Definitely more than worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX260 HS
Reviews.Author: grandma g
Reviews.Content: Love this camera for its size and usability, also the zoom. I wish the pixels were a little higher though.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: BanjoAndy
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and use.  Great features.  Amazing picture quality.  Decent battery life.  I ordered with the essential accessory pack, which for $30 gives me all the accessories I could ever want for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Rocky
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, it fits in your pocket but has good quality glass and 12x zoom. Best pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful zoom.
Reviews.Author: Joann Girard
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Takes beautiful close ups. Looking forward to taking it up to Mackinac Island, and getting some great shots.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, powerful zoom in a small size.
Reviews.Author: deanschlichting
Reviews.Content: This camera is almost exactly what I wanted, and takes great pictures. I am a field biologist and it use it for all my photography needs while in the field. The zoom is very powerful, and it has all kinds of fun setting to play with. Activating the GPS option is a bit awkward, and it wears down your battery fast. But under the right situations it could be a useful tool.
